   336        row += 1
   337
   338        self.compress_btn = ttk.Button(button_frame, text="Compress", command=self._start_compression)
   339        self.compress_btn.pack(side="left")
   340
   341        self.cancel_btn = ttk.Button(button_frame, text="Cancel", command=self._cancel_compression, state="disabled")
   342        self.cancel_btn.pack(side="left", padx=(10, 0))
   343
   344    def _setup_drag_and_drop(self):
   345        """Configure drag-and-drop if available."""
   346        if not HAS_DND:
   347            self.drop_label.config(text="Drop video files here\n(install tkinterdnd2 for drag-drop)\nor click Browse")
   348            return
   349
   350        # Register drop target on the drop frame and label
   351        self.drop_frame.drop_target_register(DND_FILES)
   352        self.drop_frame.dnd_bind("<<Drop>>", self._on_drop)
   353        self.drop_frame.dnd_bind("<<DragEnter>>", self._on_drag_enter)
   354        self.drop_frame.dnd_bind("<<DragLeave>>", self._on_drag_leave)
   355
   356        self.drop_label.drop_target_register(DND_FILES)
   357        self.drop_label.dnd_bind("<<Drop>>", self._on_drop)
   358        self.drop_label.dnd_bind("<<DragEnter>>", self._on_drag_enter)
   359        self.drop_label.dnd_bind("<<DragLeave>>", self._on_drag_leave)
   360
   361    def _on_drop(self, event):
   362        """Handle files dropped onto the drop zone."""
   363        # Parse the dropped file paths
   364        data = event.data
   365        files = self._parse_drop_data(data)
   366
   367        # Filter for video files
   368        video_extensions = {".mp4", ".mkv", ".avi", ".mov", ".webm", ".flv", ".wmv", ".m4v"}
   369        video_files = [f for f in files if Path(f).suffix.lower() in video_extensions]
   370
   371        if video_files:
   372            self.input_files = [Path(f) for f in video_files]
   373            if len(self.input_files) == 1:
   374                self.input_label.config(text=self.input_files[0].name, foreground="black")
   375                self.drop_label.config(text=f"Selected: {self.input_files[0].name}")
   376            else:
   377                self.input_label.config(text=f"{len(self.input_files)} files selected", foreground="black")
   378                self.drop_label.config(text=f"Selected: {len(self.input_files)} video files")
   379        else:
   380            messagebox.showwarning("Invalid Files", "No valid video files found in drop.")
   381
   382        # Reset drop zone appearance
   383        self._on_drag_leave(None)
   384
   385    def _parse_drop_data(self, data: str) -> list[str]:
   386        """Parse dropped file data which may contain multiple files."""
   387        files = []
   388        # Handle different formats: space-separated, with {} for paths with spaces
   389        if "{" in data:
   390            # Format: {/path/with spaces/file.mp4} {/another/file.mp4}
   391            import re
   392            files = re.findall(r"\{([^}]+)\}", data)
   393            # Also get non-bracketed items
   394            remaining = re.sub(r"\{[^}]+\}", "", data).strip()
   395            if remaining:
   396                files.extend(remaining.split())
   397        else:
   398            files = data.split()
   399
   400        return [f for f in files if f]
   401
   402    def _on_drag_enter(self, event):
   403        """Highlight drop zone when dragging over."""
   404        self.drop_frame.config(bg="#d0e8ff", highlightbackground="#0078d4")
   405        self.drop_label.config(bg="#d0e8ff", fg="#0078d4", text="Drop to add files")
   406
   407    def _on_drag_leave(self, event):
   408        """Reset drop zone appearance."""
   409        self.drop_frame.config(bg="#e8e8e8", highlightbackground="#aaaaaa")
   410        if self.input_files:
   411            if len(self.input_files) == 1:
   412                text = f"Selected: {self.input_files[0].name}"
   413            else:
   414                text = f"Selected: {len(self.input_files)} video files"
   415        else:
   416            text = "Drop video files here\nor click Browse"
   417        self.drop_label.config(bg="#e8e8e8", fg="#666666", text=text)
   418
   419    def _update_encoder_options(self, event=None):
   420        """Update encoder dropdown based on selected codec."""
   421        codec = self.codec_var.get()
   422        matching = [(name, info) for name, info in self.available_encoders.items() if info.codec == codec]
   423
   424        # Sort: hardware encoders first
   425        matching.sort(key=lambda x: (not x[1].is_hardware, x[0]))
   426
   427        encoder_names = [info.display_name for _, info in matching]
   428        self.encoder_combo["values"] = encoder_names
   429
   430        if encoder_names:
   431            self.encoder_combo.current(0)
   432            self._on_encoder_changed()
   433
   434    def _on_encoder_changed(self, event=None):
   435        """Update presets when encoder changes."""
   436        display_name = self.encoder_var.get()
   437        for name, info in self.available_encoders.items():
   438            if info.display_name == display_name:
   439                self.preset_combo["values"] = info.presets
   440                mid_idx = len(info.presets) // 2
   441                self.preset_combo.current(mid_idx)
   442                break
   443
   444    def _update_quality_widgets(self):
   445        """Show/hide quality widgets based on mode."""
   446        if self.quality_mode_var.get() == "crf":
   447            self.crf_frame.grid()
   448            self.bitrate_frame.grid_remove()
   449        else:
   450            self.crf_frame.grid_remove()
   451            self.bitrate_frame.grid()
   452
   453    def _update_crf_label(self, value=None):
   454        """Update CRF label with quality description."""
   455        crf = int(float(self.crf_var.get()))
   456        if crf <= 18:
   457            desc = "High Quality"
   458        elif crf <= 23:
   459            desc = "Balanced"
   460        elif crf <= 28:
   461            desc = "Smaller File"
   462        else:
   463            desc = "Low Quality"
   464        self.crf_label.config(text=f"{crf} ({desc})")
   465
   466    def _update_audio_widgets(self):
   467        """Show/hide audio bitrate based on mode."""
   468        if self.audio_mode_var.get() == "reencode":
   469            self.audio_bitrate_frame.grid()
   470        else:
   471            self.audio_bitrate_frame.grid_remove()
   472
   473    def _on_resolution_changed(self, event=None):
   474        """Show/hide custom resolution inputs."""
   475        if self.resolution_var.get() == "Custom":
   476            self.custom_res_frame.grid()
   477        else:
   478            self.custom_res_frame.grid_remove()
   479
   480    def _browse_input(self):
   481        """Open file browser for input files."""
   482        filetypes = [
   483            ("Video files", "*.mp4 *.mkv *.avi *.mov *.webm *.flv *.wmv *.m4v"),
   484            ("All files", "*.*"),
   485        ]
   486        files = filedialog.askopenfilenames(title="Select Video Files", filetypes=filetypes)
   487        if files:
   488            self.input_files = [Path(f) for f in files]
   489            if len(self.input_files) == 1:
   490                self.input_label.config(text=self.input_files[0].name, foreground="black")
   491            else:
   492                self.input_label.config(text=f"{len(self.input_files)} files selected", foreground="black")
   493
   494    def _clear_input(self):
   495        """Clear selected input files."""
   496        self.input_files = []
   497        self.input_label.config(text="No files selected", foreground="gray")
   498        self.drop_label.config(text="Drop video files here\nor click Browse")
   499
   500    def _browse_output(self):
   501        """Open folder browser for output."""
   502        folder = filedialog.askdirectory(title="Select Output Folder")
   503        if folder:
   504            self.output_var.set(folder)
   505
   506    def _get_encoder_info(self) -> EncoderInfo | None:
   507        """Get the currently selected encoder info."""
   508        display_name = self.encoder_var.get()
   509        for name, info in self.available_encoders.items():
   510            if info.display_name == display_name:
   511                return info
   512        return None
   513
   514    def _get_encoder_name(self) -> str | None:
   515        """Get the FFmpeg encoder name for the selected encoder."""
   516        display_name = self.encoder_var.get()
   517        for name, info in self.available_encoders.items():
   518            if info.display_name == display_name:
   519                return name
   520        return None
   521
   522    def _build_ffmpeg_command(self, input_path: Path, output_path: Path) -> list[str]:
   523        """Build the FFmpeg command with all options."""
   524        encoder_name = self._get_encoder_name()
   525        encoder_info = self._get_encoder_info()
   526
   527        cmd = ["ffmpeg", "-y", "-i", str(input_path)]
   528
   529        # Video encoder
   530        cmd.extend(["-c:v", encoder_name])
   531
   532        # Quality settings
   533        if self.quality_mode_var.get() == "crf":
   534            quality_val = int(self.crf_var.get())
   535            if encoder_info.quality_param == "cq":
   536                cmd.extend(["-rc", "constqp", "-cq", str(quality_val)])
   537            elif encoder_info.quality_param == "global_quality":
   538                cmd.extend(["-global_quality", str(quality_val)])
   539            elif encoder_info.quality_param == "qp_i":
   540                cmd.extend(["-rc", "cqp", "-qp_i", str(quality_val), "-qp_p", str(quality_val), "-qp_b", str(quality_val)])
   541            else:
   542                cmd.extend(["-crf", str(quality_val)])
   543        else:
   544            bitrate = self.bitrate_var.get()
   545            cmd.extend(["-b:v", f"{bitrate}k"])
   546
   547        # Preset
   548        preset = self.preset_var.get()
   549        if encoder_name in ("h264_nvenc", "hevc_nvenc"):
   550            cmd.extend(["-preset", preset])
   551        elif encoder_name in ("h264_amf", "hevc_amf"):
   552            cmd.extend(["-quality", preset])
   553        else:
   554            cmd.extend(["-preset", preset])
   555
   556        # Resolution
   557        resolution = self.resolution_var.get()
   558        scale_filter = None
   559        if resolution == "Custom":
   560            w = self.custom_width_var.get()
   561            h = self.custom_height_var.get()
   562            scale_filter = f"scale={w}:{h}"
   563        elif resolution != "Keep Original":
   564            res_value = self.RESOLUTIONS[resolution]
   565            if res_value:
   566                w, h = res_value.split("x")
   567                scale_filter = f"scale={w}:{h}:force_original_aspect_ratio=decrease"
   568
   569        # Frame rate
   570        fps = self.fps_var.get()
   571        fps_filter = None
   572        if fps != "Keep Original":
   573            fps_filter = f"fps={fps}"
   574
   575        # Combine video filters
   576        vf_parts = [f for f in [scale_filter, fps_filter] if f]
   577        if vf_parts:
   578            cmd.extend(["-vf", ",".join(vf_parts)])
   579
   580        # Audio settings
   581        audio_mode = self.audio_mode_var.get()
   582        if audio_mode == "reencode":
   583            cmd.extend(["-c:a", "aac", "-b:a", self.audio_bitrate_var.get()])
   584        elif audio_mode == "copy":
   585            cmd.extend(["-c:a", "copy"])
   586        else:
   587            cmd.append("-an")
   588
   589        cmd.append(str(output_path))
   590        return cmd
   591
   592    def _get_video_duration(self, path: Path) -> float | None:
   593        """Get video duration in seconds using ffprobe."""
   594        try:
   595            result = subprocess.run(
   596                [
   597                    "ffprobe", "-v", "quiet", "-print_format", "json",
   598                    "-show_format", str(path)
   599                ],
   600                capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=30
   601            )
   602            data = json.loads(result.stdout)
   603            return float(data["format"]["duration"])
   604        except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, json.JSONDecodeError, KeyError, FileNotFoundError):
   605            return None
   606
   607    def _parse_progress(self, line: str, duration: float | None) -> float | None:
   608        """Parse FFmpeg output to get progress percentage."""
   609        if duration is None:
   610            return None
   611        time_match = re.search(r"time=(\d+):(\d+):(\d+\.?\d*)", line)
   612        if time_match:
   613            h, m, s = time_match.groups()
   614            current = int(h) * 3600 + int(m) * 60 + float(s)
   615            return min(100, (current / duration) * 100)
   616        return None
   617
   618    def _update_status(self, message: str, color: str = "gray"):
   619        """Update status label (thread-safe)."""
   620        self.root.after(0, lambda: self.status_var.set(message))
   621        self.root.after(0, lambda: self.status_label.config(foreground=color))
   622
   623    def _update_progress(self, value: float):
   624        """Update progress bar (thread-safe)."""
   625        self.root.after(0, lambda: self.progress_var.set(value))
   626
   627    def _append_result(self, text: str):
   628        """Append text to result area (thread-safe)."""
   629        def _append():
   630            self.result_text.config(state="normal")
   631            self.result_text.insert("end", text + "\n")
   632            self.result_text.see("end")
   633            self.result_text.config(state="disabled")
   634        self.root.after(0, _append)
   635
   636    def _clear_result(self):
   637        """Clear result area."""
   638        self.result_text.config(state="normal")
   639        self.result_text.delete("1.0", "end")
   640        self.result_text.config(state="disabled")
   641
   642    def _compression_finished(self, success: bool):
   643        """Called when compression completes (thread-safe)."""
   644        def _finish():
   645            self.is_compressing = False
   646            self.compress_btn.config(state="normal")
   647            self.cancel_btn.config(state="disabled")
   648            if success:
   649                self._update_status("Completed!", "green")
   650            elif self.cancel_requested:
   651                self._update_status("Cancelled", "orange")
   652            else:
   653                self._update_status("Failed", "red")
   654        self.root.after(0, _finish)
   655
   656    def _start_compression(self):
   657        """Start the compression process."""
   658        if not self.input_files:
   659            messagebox.showwarning("No Input", "Please select input video files.")
   660            return
   661
   662        self.is_compressing = True
   663        self.cancel_requested = False
   664        self.compress_btn.config(state="disabled")
   665        self.cancel_btn.config(state="normal")
   666        self._clear_result()
   667        self._update_progress(0)
   668
   669        thread = threading.Thread(target=self._compress_files, daemon=True)
   670        thread.start()
   671
   672    def _cancel_compression(self):
   673        """Cancel the current compression."""
   674        self.cancel_requested = True
   675        if self.current_process:
   676            self.current_process.terminate()
   677
   678    def _compress_files(self):
   679        """Compress all input files (runs in background thread)."""
   680        total_files = len(self.input_files)
   681        total_input_size = 0
   682        total_output_size = 0
   683
   684        for i, input_path in enumerate(self.input_files):
   685            if self.cancel_requested:
   686                break
   687
   688            self._update_status(f"Processing {i+1}/{total_files}: {input_path.name}")
   689
   690            # Determine output path
   691            output_dir = self.output_var.get()
   692            if output_dir == "Same as input":
   693                output_dir = input_path.parent
   694            else:
   695                output_dir = Path(output_dir)
   696
   697            suffix = self.suffix_var.get()
   698            container = self.container_var.get()
   699            output_path = output_dir / f"{input_path.stem}{suffix}{container}"
   700
   701            # Get duration for progress
   702            duration = self._get_video_duration(input_path)
   703
   704            # Build and run command
   705            cmd = self._build_ffmpeg_command(input_path, output_path)
   706
   707            try:
   708                self.current_process = subprocess.Popen(
   709                    cmd, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
   710                    text=True, bufsize=1
   711                )
   712
   713                for line in self.current_process.stderr:
   714                    if self.cancel_requested:
   715                        break
   716                    progress = self._parse_progress(line, duration)
   717                    if progress is not None:
   718                        # Adjust for multiple files
   719                        overall = (i * 100 + progress) / total_files
   720                        self._update_progress(overall)
   721
   722                self.current_process.wait()
   723
   724                if self.current_process.returncode == 0 and output_path.exists():
   725                    input_size = input_path.stat().st_size / (1024 * 1024)
   726                    output_size = output_path.stat().st_size / (1024 * 1024)
   727                    reduction = (1 - output_size / input_size) * 100
   728
   729                    total_input_size += input_size
   730                    total_output_size += output_size
   731
   732                    self._append_result(
   733                        f"{input_path.name}: {input_size:.1f}MB  {output_size:.1f}MB ({reduction:.1f}% smaller)"
   734                    )
   735                elif not self.cancel_requested:
   736                    self._append_result(f"{input_path.name}: FAILED")
   737
   738            except Exception as e:
   739                self._append_result(f"{input_path.name}: Error - {str(e)}")
   740
   741        # Summary
   742        if total_files > 1 and total_input_size > 0:
   743            total_reduction = (1 - total_output_size / total_input_size) * 100
   744            self._append_result(f"\nTotal: {total_input_size:.1f}MB  {total_output_size:.1f}MB ({total_reduction:.1f}% smaller)")
   745
   746        self._update_progress(100 if not self.cancel_requested else 0)
   747        self._compression_finished(not self.cancel_requested)
   748
   749
   750def main():
   751    if HAS_DND:
   752        root = TkinterDnD.Tk()
   753    else:
   754        root = tk.Tk()
   755    app = VideoCompressorGUI(root)
   756    root.mainloop()
   757
   758
   759if __name__ == "__main__":
   760    main()
   761

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""Video Compressor GUI with hardware acceleration support."""

import json
import os
import re
import subprocess
import threading
import tkinter as tk
from tkinter import ttk, filedialog, messagebox
from pathlib import Path
from dataclasses import dataclass
from typing import Callable

try:
    from tkinterdnd2 import DND_FILES, TkinterDnD
    HAS_DND = True
except ImportError:
    HAS_DND = False


@dataclass
class EncoderInfo:
    """Information about an available encoder."""
    name: str
    display_name: str
    codec: str  # h264 or h265
    is_hardware: bool
    quality_param: str  # crf, cq, or global_quality
    quality_range: tuple[int, int]
    presets: list[str]


class HardwareDetector:
    """Detect available hardware encoders."""

    ENCODERS = {
        # NVIDIA NVENC
        "h264_nvenc": EncoderInfo(
            "h264_nvenc", "NVIDIA NVENC (H.264)", "h264", True,
            "cq", (0, 51), ["p1", "p2", "p3", "p4", "p5", "p6", "p7"]
        ),
        "hevc_nvenc": EncoderInfo(
            "hevc_nvenc", "NVIDIA NVENC (H.265)", "h265", True,
            "cq", (0, 51), ["p1", "p2", "p3", "p4", "p5", "p6", "p7"]
        ),
        # AMD AMF
        "h264_amf": EncoderInfo(
            "h264_amf", "AMD AMF (H.264)", "h264", True,
            "qp_i", (0, 51), ["speed", "balanced", "quality"]
        ),
        "hevc_amf": EncoderInfo(
            "hevc_amf", "AMD AMF (H.265)", "h265", True,
            "qp_i", (0, 51), ["speed", "balanced", "quality"]
        ),
        # Intel QuickSync
        "h264_qsv": EncoderInfo(
            "h264_qsv", "Intel QuickSync (H.264)", "h264", True,
            "global_quality", (1, 51), ["veryfast", "faster", "fast", "medium", "slow", "slower", "veryslow"]
        ),
        "hevc_qsv": EncoderInfo(
            "hevc_qsv", "Intel QuickSync (H.265)", "h265", True,
            "global_quality", (1, 51), ["veryfast", "faster", "fast", "medium", "slow", "slower", "veryslow"]
        ),
        # Software (always available)
        "libx264": EncoderInfo(
            "libx264", "Software (H.264)", "h264", False,
            "crf", (0, 51), ["ultrafast", "superfast", "veryfast", "faster", "fast", "medium", "slow", "slower", "veryslow"]
        ),
        "libx265": EncoderInfo(
            "libx265", "Software (H.265)", "h265", False,
            "crf", (0, 51), ["ultrafast", "superfast", "veryfast", "faster", "fast", "medium", "slow", "slower", "veryslow"]
        ),
    }

    @staticmethod
    def get_available_encoders() -> dict[str, EncoderInfo]:
        """Detect which encoders are available on the system."""
        available = {}

        try:
            result = subprocess.run(
                ["ffmpeg", "-encoders", "-hide_banner"],
                capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=10
            )
            output = result.stdout
        except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
            # Fallback to software only
            return {
                "libx264": HardwareDetector.ENCODERS["libx264"],
                "libx265": HardwareDetector.ENCODERS["libx265"],
            }

        for name, info in HardwareDetector.ENCODERS.items():
            if name in output:
                # Additional check for hardware encoders
                if info.is_hardware:
                    if HardwareDetector._test_encoder(name):
                        available[name] = info
                else:
                    available[name] = info

        return available

    @staticmethod
    def _test_encoder(encoder: str) -> bool:
        """Test if a hardware encoder actually works."""
        try:
            result = subprocess.run(
                [
                    "ffmpeg", "-hide_banner", "-f", "lavfi",
                    "-i", "nullsrc=s=256x256:d=1",
                    "-c:v", encoder, "-f", "null", "-"
                ],
                capture_output=True, timeout=10
            )
            return result.returncode == 0
        except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
            return False


class VideoCompressorGUI:
    """Main GUI application for video compression."""

    RESOLUTIONS = {
        "Keep Original": None,
        "4K (2160p)": "3840x2160",
        "1440p": "2560x1440",
        "1080p": "1920x1080",
        "720p": "1280x720",
        "480p": "854x480",
        "Custom": "custom",
    }

    AUDIO_BITRATES = ["64k", "96k", "128k", "192k", "256k", "320k"]
    FRAME_RATES = ["Keep Original", "24", "30", "60"]
    CONTAINERS = [".mp4", ".mkv", ".webm"]

    def __init__(self, root: tk.Tk):
        self.root = root
        self.root.title("Video Compressor")
        self.root.geometry("700x800")
        self.root.minsize(600, 750)

        # Detect available encoders
        self.available_encoders = HardwareDetector.get_available_encoders()

        # State variables
        self.input_files: list[Path] = []
        self.is_compressing = False
        self.cancel_requested = False
        self.current_process: subprocess.Popen | None = None

        self._create_widgets()
        self._update_encoder_options()
        self._setup_drag_and_drop()

    def _create_widgets(self):
        """Create all GUI widgets."""
        main_frame = ttk.Frame(self.root, padding="10")
        main_frame.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")
        self.root.columnconfigure(0, weight=1)

    def _setup_drag_and_drop(self):
        """Configure drag-and-drop if available."""
        if not HAS_DND:
            self.drop_label.config(text="Drop video files here\n(install tkinterdnd2 for drag-drop)\nor click Browse")
            return

        # Register drop target on the drop frame and label
        self.drop_frame.drop_target_register(DND_FILES)
        self.drop_frame.dnd_bind("<<Drop>>", self._on_drop)
        self.drop_frame.dnd_bind("<<DragEnter>>", self._on_drag_enter)
        self.drop_frame.dnd_bind("<<DragLeave>>", self._on_drag_leave)

        self.drop_label.drop_target_register(DND_FILES)
        self.drop_label.dnd_bind("<<Drop>>", self._on_drop)
        self.drop_label.dnd_bind("<<DragEnter>>", self._on_drag_enter)
        self.drop_label.dnd_bind("<<DragLeave>>", self._on_drag_leave)

    def _on_drop(self, event):
        """Handle files dropped onto the drop zone."""
        # Parse the dropped file paths
        data = event.data
        files = self._parse_drop_data(data)

        # Filter for video files
        video_extensions = {".mp4", ".mkv", ".avi", ".mov", ".webm", ".flv", ".wmv", ".m4v"}
        video_files = [f for f in files if Path(f).suffix.lower() in video_extensions]

        if video_files:
            self.input_files = [Path(f) for f in video_files]
            if len(self.input_files) == 1:
                self.input_label.config(text=self.input_files[0].name, foreground="black")
                self.drop_label.config(text=f"Selected: {self.input_files[0].name}")
            else:
                self.input_label.config(text=f"{len(self.input_files)} files selected", foreground="black")
                self.drop_label.config(text=f"Selected: {len(self.input_files)} video files")
        else:
            messagebox.showwarning("Invalid Files", "No valid video files found in drop.")

        # Reset drop zone appearance
        self._on_drag_leave(None)

    def _parse_drop_data(self, data: str) -> list[str]:
        """Parse dropped file data which may contain multiple files."""
        files = []
        # Handle different formats: space-separated, with {} for paths with spaces
        if "{" in data:
            # Format: {/path/with spaces/file.mp4} {/another/file.mp4}
            import re
            files = re.findall(r"\{([^}]+)\}", data)
            # Also get non-bracketed items
            remaining = re.sub(r"\{[^}]+\}", "", data).strip()
            if remaining:
                files.extend(remaining.split())
        else:
            files = data.split()

        return [f for f in files if f]

    def _on_drag_enter(self, event):
        """Highlight drop zone when dragging over."""
        self.drop_frame.config(bg="#d0e8ff", highlightbackground="#0078d4")
        self.drop_label.config(bg="#d0e8ff", fg="#0078d4", text="Drop to add files")

    def _on_drag_leave(self, event):
        """Reset drop zone appearance."""
        self.drop_frame.config(bg="#e8e8e8", highlightbackground="#aaaaaa")
        if self.input_files:
            if len(self.input_files) == 1:
                text = f"Selected: {self.input_files[0].name}"
            else:
                text = f"Selected: {len(self.input_files)} video files"
        else:
            text = "Drop video files here\nor click Browse"
        self.drop_label.config(bg="#e8e8e8", fg="#666666", text=text)

    def _update_encoder_options(self, event=None):
        """Update encoder dropdown based on selected codec."""
        codec = self.codec_var.get()
        matching = [(name, info) for name, info in self.available_encoders.items() if info.codec == codec]

        # Sort: hardware encoders first
        matching.sort(key=lambda x: (not x[1].is_hardware, x[0]))

        encoder_names = [info.display_name for _, info in matching]
        self.encoder_combo["values"] = encoder_names

        if encoder_names:
            self.encoder_combo.current(0)
            self._on_encoder_changed()

    def _on_encoder_changed(self, event=None):
        """Update presets when encoder changes."""
        display_name = self.encoder_var.get()
        for name, info in self.available_encoders.items():
            if info.display_name == display_name:
                self.preset_combo["values"] = info.presets
                mid_idx = len(info.presets) // 2
                self.preset_combo.current(mid_idx)
                break

    def _update_quality_widgets(self):
        """Show/hide quality widgets based on mode."""
        if self.quality_mode_var.get() == "crf":
            self.crf_frame.grid()
            self.bitrate_frame.grid_remove()
        else:
            self.crf_frame.grid_remove()
            self.bitrate_frame.grid()

    def _update_crf_label(self, value=None):
        """Update CRF label with quality description."""
        crf = int(float(self.crf_var.get()))
        if crf <= 18:
            desc = "High Quality"
        elif crf <= 23:
            desc = "Balanced"
        elif crf <= 28:
            desc = "Smaller File"
        else:
            desc = "Low Quality"
        self.crf_label.config(text=f"{crf} ({desc})")

    def _update_audio_widgets(self):
        """Show/hide audio bitrate based on mode."""
        if self.audio_mode_var.get() == "reencode":
            self.audio_bitrate_frame.grid()
        else:
            self.audio_bitrate_frame.grid_remove()

    def _on_resolution_changed(self, event=None):
        """Show/hide custom resolution inputs."""
        if self.resolution_var.get() == "Custom":
            self.custom_res_frame.grid()
        else:
            self.custom_res_frame.grid_remove()

    def _browse_input(self):
        """Open file browser for input files."""
        filetypes = [
            ("Video files", "*.mp4 *.mkv *.avi *.mov *.webm *.flv *.wmv *.m4v"),
            ("All files", "*.*"),
        ]
        files = filedialog.askopenfilenames(title="Select Video Files", filetypes=filetypes)
        if files:
            self.input_files = [Path(f) for f in files]
            if len(self.input_files) == 1:
                self.input_label.config(text=self.input_files[0].name, foreground="black")
            else:
                self.input_label.config(text=f"{len(self.input_files)} files selected", foreground="black")

    def _clear_input(self):
        """Clear selected input files."""
        self.input_files = []
        self.input_label.config(text="No files selected", foreground="gray")
        self.drop_label.config(text="Drop video files here\nor click Browse")

    def _browse_output(self):
        """Open folder browser for output."""
        folder = filedialog.askdirectory(title="Select Output Folder")
        if folder:
            self.output_var.set(folder)

    def _get_encoder_info(self) -> EncoderInfo | None:
        """Get the currently selected encoder info."""
        display_name = self.encoder_var.get()
        for name, info in self.available_encoders.items():
            if info.display_name == display_name:
                return info
        return None

    def _get_encoder_name(self) -> str | None:
        """Get the FFmpeg encoder name for the selected encoder."""
        display_name = self.encoder_var.get()
        for name, info in self.available_encoders.items():
            if info.display_name == display_name:
                return name
        return None

    def _build_ffmpeg_command(self, input_path: Path, output_path: Path) -> list[str]:
        """Build the FFmpeg command with all options."""
        encoder_name = self._get_encoder_name()
        encoder_info = self._get_encoder_info()

        cmd = ["ffmpeg", "-y", "-i", str(input_path)]

        # Video encoder
        cmd.extend(["-c:v", encoder_name])

        # Quality settings
        if self.quality_mode_var.get() == "crf":
            quality_val = int(self.crf_var.get())
            if encoder_info.quality_param == "cq":
                cmd.extend(["-rc", "constqp", "-cq", str(quality_val)])
            elif encoder_info.quality_param == "global_quality":
                cmd.extend(["-global_quality", str(quality_val)])
            elif encoder_info.quality_param == "qp_i":
                cmd.extend(["-rc", "cqp", "-qp_i", str(quality_val), "-qp_p", str(quality_val), "-qp_b", str(quality_val)])
            else:
                cmd.extend(["-crf", str(quality_val)])
        else:
            bitrate = self.bitrate_var.get()
            cmd.extend(["-b:v", f"{bitrate}k"])

        # Preset
        preset = self.preset_var.get()
        if encoder_name in ("h264_nvenc", "hevc_nvenc"):
            cmd.extend(["-preset", preset])
        elif encoder_name in ("h264_amf", "hevc_amf"):
            cmd.extend(["-quality", preset])
        else:
            cmd.extend(["-preset", preset])

        # Resolution
        resolution = self.resolution_var.get()
        scale_filter = None
        if resolution == "Custom":
            w = self.custom_width_var.get()
            h = self.custom_height_var.get()
            scale_filter = f"scale={w}:{h}"
        elif resolution != "Keep Original":
            res_value = self.RESOLUTIONS[resolution]
            if res_value:
                w, h = res_value.split("x")
                scale_filter = f"scale={w}:{h}:force_original_aspect_ratio=decrease"

        # Frame rate
        fps = self.fps_var.get()
        fps_filter = None
        if fps != "Keep Original":
            fps_filter = f"fps={fps}"

        # Combine video filters
        vf_parts = [f for f in [scale_filter, fps_filter] if f]
        if vf_parts:
            cmd.extend(["-vf", ",".join(vf_parts)])

        # Audio settings
        audio_mode = self.audio_mode_var.get()
        if audio_mode == "reencode":
            cmd.extend(["-c:a", "aac", "-b:a", self.audio_bitrate_var.get()])
        elif audio_mode == "copy":
            cmd.extend(["-c:a", "copy"])
        else:
            cmd.append("-an")

        cmd.append(str(output_path))
        return cmd

    def _get_video_duration(self, path: Path) -> float | None:
        """Get video duration in seconds using ffprobe."""
        try:
            result = subprocess.run(
                [
                    "ffprobe", "-v", "quiet", "-print_format", "json",
                    "-show_format", str(path)
                ],
                capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=30
            )
            data = json.loads(result.stdout)
            return float(data["format"]["duration"])
        except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, json.JSONDecodeError, KeyError, FileNotFoundError):
            return None

    def _parse_progress(self, line: str, duration: float | None) -> float | None:
        """Parse FFmpeg output to get progress percentage."""
        if duration is None:
            return None
        time_match = re.search(r"time=(\d+):(\d+):(\d+\.?\d*)", line)
        if time_match:
            h, m, s = time_match.groups()
            current = int(h) * 3600 + int(m) * 60 + float(s)
            return min(100, (current / duration) * 100)
        return None

    def _update_status(self, message: str, color: str = "gray"):
        """Update status label (thread-safe)."""
        self.root.after(0, lambda: self.status_var.set(message))
        self.root.after(0, lambda: self.status_label.config(foreground=color))

    def _update_progress(self, value: float):
        """Update progress bar (thread-safe)."""
        self.root.after(0, lambda: self.progress_var.set(value))

    def _append_result(self, text: str):
        """Append text to result area (thread-safe)."""
        def _append():
            self.result_text.config(state="normal")
            self.result_text.insert("end", text + "\n")
            self.result_text.see("end")
            self.result_text.config(state="disabled")
        self.root.after(0, _append)

    def _clear_result(self):
        """Clear result area."""
        self.result_text.config(state="normal")
        self.result_text.delete("1.0", "end")
        self.result_text.config(state="disabled")

    def _compression_finished(self, success: bool):
        """Called when compression completes (thread-safe)."""
        def _finish():
            self.is_compressing = False
            self.compress_btn.config(state="normal")
            self.cancel_btn.config(state="disabled")
            if success:
                self._update_status("Completed!", "green")
            elif self.cancel_requested:
                self._update_status("Cancelled", "orange")
            else:
                self._update_status("Failed", "red")
        self.root.after(0, _finish)

    def _start_compression(self):
        """Start the compression process."""
        if not self.input_files:
            messagebox.showwarning("No Input", "Please select input video files.")
            return

        self.is_compressing = True
        self.cancel_requested = False
        self.compress_btn.config(state="disabled")
        self.cancel_btn.config(state="normal")
        self._clear_result()
        self._update_progress(0)

        thread = threading.Thread(target=self._compress_files, daemon=True)
        thread.start()

    def _cancel_compression(self):
        """Cancel the current compression."""
        self.cancel_requested = True
        if self.current_process:
            self.current_process.terminate()

    def _compress_files(self):
        """Compress all input files (runs in background thread)."""
        total_files = len(self.input_files)
        total_input_size = 0
        total_output_size = 0

        for i, input_path in enumerate(self.input_files):
            if self.cancel_requested:
                break

            self._update_status(f"Processing {i+1}/{total_files}: {input_path.name}")

            # Determine output path
            output_dir = self.output_var.get()
            if output_dir == "Same as input":
                output_dir = input_path.parent
            else:
                output_dir = Path(output_dir)

            suffix = self.suffix_var.get()
            container = self.container_var.get()
            output_path = output_dir / f"{input_path.stem}{suffix}{container}"

            # Get duration for progress
            duration = self._get_video_duration(input_path)

            # Build and run command
            cmd = self._build_ffmpeg_command(input_path, output_path)

            try:
                self.current_process = subprocess.Popen(
                    cmd, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
                    text=True, bufsize=1
                )

                for line in self.current_process.stderr:
                    if self.cancel_requested:
                        break
                    progress = self._parse_progress(line, duration)
                    if progress is not None:
                        # Adjust for multiple files
                        overall = (i * 100 + progress) / total_files
                        self._update_progress(overall)

                self.current_process.wait()

                if self.current_process.returncode == 0 and output_path.exists():
                    input_size = input_path.stat().st_size / (1024 * 1024)
                    output_size = output_path.stat().st_size / (1024 * 1024)
                    reduction = (1 - output_size / input_size) * 100

                    total_input_size += input_size
                    total_output_size += output_size

                    self._append_result(
                        f"{input_path.name}: {input_size:.1f}MB  {output_size:.1f}MB ({reduction:.1f}% smaller)"
                    )
                elif not self.cancel_requested:
                    self._append_result(f"{input_path.name}: FAILED")

            except Exception as e:
                self._append_result(f"{input_path.name}: Error - {str(e)}")

        # Summary
        if total_files > 1 and total_input_size > 0:
            total_reduction = (1 - total_output_size / total_input_size) * 100
            self._append_result(f"\nTotal: {total_input_size:.1f}MB  {total_output_size:.1f}MB ({total_reduction:.1f}% smaller)")

        self._update_progress(100 if not self.cancel_requested else 0)
        self._compression_finished(not self.cancel_requested)


def main():
    if HAS_DND:
        root = TkinterDnD.Tk()
    else:
        root = tk.Tk()
    app = VideoCompressorGUI(root)
    root.mainloop()


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

def _create_widgets(self):
        """Create all GUI widgets."""
        # Create outer frame for canvas and scrollbar
        self.root.columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
        self.root.rowconfigure(0, weight=1)

        # Canvas for scrolling

        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")

        # Scrollbar
        scrollbar = ttk.Scrollbar(self.root, orient="vertical", command=self.canvas.yview)
        scrollbar.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="ns")
        self.canvas.configure(yscrollcommand=scrollbar.set)

        # Main frame inside canvas
        main_frame = ttk.Frame(self.canvas, padding="10")
        self.canvas_window = self.canvas.create_window((0, 0), window=main_frame, anchor="nw")

        # Configure canvas scrolling
        def _configure_scroll(event):
            self.canvas.configure(scrollregion=self.canvas.bbox("all"))

        def _configure_canvas_width(event):
            self.canvas.itemconfig(self.canvas_window, width=event.width)

        main_frame.bind("<Configure>", _configure_scroll)
        self.canvas.bind("<Configure>", _configure_canvas_width)

        # Mouse wheel scrolling
        def _on_mousewheel(event):
            self.canvas.yview_scroll(int(-1 * (event.delta / 120)), "units")

        def _on_mousewheel_linux(event):
            if event.num == 4:

        self.canvas.bind_all("<Button-5>", _on_mousewheel_linux)

        main_frame.columnconfigure(0, weight=1)

        row = 0

        # === Drop Zone ===

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""Video Compressor GUI with hardware acceleration support."""

import json
import os
import re
import subprocess
import threading
import tkinter as tk
from tkinter import ttk, filedialog, messagebox
from pathlib import Path
from dataclasses import dataclass
from typing import Callable

try:
    from tkinterdnd2 import DND_FILES, TkinterDnD
    HAS_DND = True
except ImportError:
    HAS_DND = False


@dataclass
class EncoderInfo:
    """Information about an available encoder."""
    name: str
    display_name: str
    codec: str  # h264 or h265
    is_hardware: bool
    quality_param: str  # crf, cq, or global_quality
    quality_range: tuple[int, int]
    presets: list[str]


class HardwareDetector:
    """Detect available hardware encoders."""

    ENCODERS = {
        # NVIDIA NVENC
        "h264_nvenc": EncoderInfo(
            "h264_nvenc", "NVIDIA NVENC (H.264)", "h264", True,
            "cq", (0, 51), ["p1", "p2", "p3", "p4", "p5", "p6", "p7"]
        ),
        "hevc_nvenc": EncoderInfo(
            "hevc_nvenc", "NVIDIA NVENC (H.265)", "h265", True,
            "cq", (0, 51), ["p1", "p2", "p3", "p4", "p5", "p6", "p7"]
        ),
        # AMD AMF
        "h264_amf": EncoderInfo(
            "h264_amf", "AMD AMF (H.264)", "h264", True,
            "qp_i", (0, 51), ["speed", "balanced", "quality"]
        ),
        "hevc_amf": EncoderInfo(
            "hevc_amf", "AMD AMF (H.265)", "h265", True,
            "qp_i", (0, 51), ["speed", "balanced", "quality"]
        ),
        # Intel QuickSync
        "h264_qsv": EncoderInfo(
            "h264_qsv", "Intel QuickSync (H.264)", "h264", True,
            "global_quality", (1, 51), ["veryfast", "faster", "fast", "medium", "slow", "slower", "veryslow"]
        ),
        "hevc_qsv": EncoderInfo(
            "hevc_qsv", "Intel QuickSync (H.265)", "h265", True,
            "global_quality", (1, 51), ["veryfast", "faster", "fast", "medium", "slow", "slower", "veryslow"]
        ),
        # Software (always available)
        "libx264": EncoderInfo(
            "libx264", "Software (H.264)", "h264", False,
            "crf", (0, 51), ["ultrafast", "superfast", "veryfast", "faster", "fast", "medium", "slow", "slower", "veryslow"]
        ),
        "libx265": EncoderInfo(
            "libx265", "Software (H.265)", "h265", False,
            "crf", (0, 51), ["ultrafast", "superfast", "veryfast", "faster", "fast", "medium", "slow", "slower", "veryslow"]
        ),
    }

    @staticmethod
    def get_available_encoders() -> dict[str, EncoderInfo]:
        """Detect which encoders are available on the system."""
        available = {}

        try:
            result = subprocess.run(
                ["ffmpeg", "-encoders", "-hide_banner"],
                capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=10
            )
            output = result.stdout
        except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
            # Fallback to software only
            return {
                "libx264": HardwareDetector.ENCODERS["libx264"],
                "libx265": HardwareDetector.ENCODERS["libx265"],
            }

        for name, info in HardwareDetector.ENCODERS.items():
            if name in output:
                # Additional check for hardware encoders
                if info.is_hardware:
                    if HardwareDetector._test_encoder(name):
                        available[name] = info
                else:
                    available[name] = info

        return available

    @staticmethod
    def _test_encoder(encoder: str) -> bool:
        """Test if a hardware encoder actually works."""
        try:
            result = subprocess.run(
                [
                    "ffmpeg", "-hide_banner", "-f", "lavfi",
                    "-i", "nullsrc=s=256x256:d=1",
                    "-c:v", encoder, "-f", "null", "-"
                ],
                capture_output=True, timeout=10
            )
            return result.returncode == 0
        except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
            return False


class VideoCompressorGUI:
    """Main GUI application for video compression."""

    RESOLUTIONS = {
        "Keep Original": None,
        "4K (2160p)": "3840x2160",
        "1440p": "2560x1440",
        "1080p": "1920x1080",
        "720p": "1280x720",
        "480p": "854x480",
        "Custom": "custom",
    }

    AUDIO_BITRATES = ["64k", "96k", "128k", "192k", "256k", "320k"]
    FRAME_RATES = ["Keep Original", "24", "30", "60"]
    CONTAINERS = [".mp4", ".mkv", ".webm"]

    def __init__(self, root: tk.Tk):
        self.root = root
        self.root.title("Video Compressor")
        self.root.geometry("700x800")
        self.root.minsize(600, 750)

        # Detect available encoders
        self.available_encoders = HardwareDetector.get_available_encoders()

        # State variables
        self.input_files: list[Path] = []
        self.is_compressing = False
        self.cancel_requested = False
        self.current_process: subprocess.Popen | None = None

        self._create_widgets()
        self._update_encoder_options()
        self._setup_drag_and_drop()

    def _create_widgets(self):
        """Create all GUI widgets."""
        main_frame = ttk.Frame(self.root, padding="10")
        main_frame.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")
        self.root.columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
        self.root.rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
        main_frame.columnconfigure(0, weight=1)

        row = 0

        # === Drop Zone ===
        self.drop_frame = tk.Frame(main_frame, bg="#e8e8e8", highlightbackground="#aaaaaa", highlightthickness=2)
        self.drop_frame.grid(row=row, column=0, sticky="ew", pady=(0, 10), ipady=20)
        row += 1

        self.drop_label = tk.Label(
            self.drop_frame,
            text="Drop video files here\nor click Browse",
            bg="#e8e8e8",
            fg="#666666",
            font=("TkDefaultFont", 11),
            cursor="hand2"
        )
        self.drop_label.pack(expand=True, fill="both", pady=10)
        self.drop_label.bind("<Button-1>", lambda e: self._browse_input())

        # === Input/Output Section ===
        io_frame = ttk.LabelFrame(main_frame, text="Input / Output", padding="10")
        io_frame.grid(row=row, column=0, sticky="ew", pady=(0, 10))
        io_frame.columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
        row += 1

        ttk.Label(io_frame, text="Input Files:").grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="w")
        self.input_label = ttk.Label(io_frame, text="No files selected", foreground="gray")
        self.input_label.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(10, 0))

        btn_frame = ttk.Frame(io_frame)
        btn_frame.grid(row=0, column=2, padx=(10, 0))
        ttk.Button(btn_frame, text="Browse", command=self._browse_input).pack(side="left")
        ttk.Button(btn_frame, text="Clear", command=self._clear_input).pack(side="left", padx=(5, 0))

        ttk.Label(io_frame, text="Output Folder:").grid(row=1, column=0, sticky="w", pady=(10, 0))
        self.output_var = tk.StringVar(value="Same as input")
        self.output_entry = ttk.Entry(io_frame, textvariable=self.output_var)
        self.output_entry.grid(row=1, column=1, sticky="ew", padx=(10, 0), pady=(10, 0))
        ttk.Button(io_frame, text="Browse", command=self._browse_output).grid(row=1, column=2, padx=(10, 0), pady=(10, 0))

        ttk.Label(io_frame, text="Filename Suffix:").grid(row=2, column=0, sticky="w", pady=(10, 0))
        self.suffix_var = tk.StringVar(value="_compressed")
        ttk.Entry(io_frame, textvariable=self.suffix_var, width=20).grid(row=2, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(10, 0), pady=(10, 0))

        ttk.Label(io_frame, text="Container:").grid(row=3, column=0, sticky="w", pady=(10, 0))
        self.container_var = tk.StringVar(value=".mp4")
        ttk.Combobox(io_frame, textvariable=self.container_var, values=self.CONTAINERS, state="readonly", width=10).grid(row=3, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(10, 0), pady=(10, 0))

        # === Encoder Section ===
        encoder_frame = ttk.LabelFrame(main_frame, text="Encoder / GPU", padding="10")
        encoder_frame.grid(row=row, column=0, sticky="ew", pady=(0, 10))
        encoder_frame.columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
        row += 1

        ttk.Label(encoder_frame, text="Codec:").grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="w")
        self.codec_var = tk.StringVar(value="h264")
        codec_frame = ttk.Frame(encoder_frame)
        codec_frame.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(10, 0))
        ttk.Radiobutton(codec_frame, text="H.264", variable=self.codec_var, value="h264", command=self._update_encoder_options).pack(side="left")
        ttk.Radiobutton(codec_frame, text="H.265 (HEVC)", variable=self.codec_var, value="h265", command=self._update_encoder_options).pack(side="left", padx=(20, 0))

        ttk.Label(encoder_frame, text="Encoder:").grid(row=1, column=0, sticky="w", pady=(10, 0))
        self.encoder_var = tk.StringVar()
        self.encoder_combo = ttk.Combobox(encoder_frame, textvariable=self.encoder_var, state="readonly", width=30)
        self.encoder_combo.grid(row=1, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(10, 0), pady=(10, 0))
        self.encoder_combo.bind("<<ComboboxSelected>>", self._on_encoder_changed)

        # === Video Quality Section ===
        quality_frame = ttk.LabelFrame(main_frame, text="Video Quality", padding="10")
        quality_frame.grid(row=row, column=0, sticky="ew", pady=(0, 10))
        quality_frame.columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
        row += 1

        ttk.Label(quality_frame, text="Mode:").grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="w")
        self.quality_mode_var = tk.StringVar(value="crf")
        mode_frame = ttk.Frame(quality_frame)
        mode_frame.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(10, 0))
        ttk.Radiobutton(mode_frame, text="Constant Quality (CRF)", variable=self.quality_mode_var, value="crf", command=self._update_quality_widgets).pack(side="left")
        ttk.Radiobutton(mode_frame, text="Target Bitrate", variable=self.quality_mode_var, value="bitrate", command=self._update_quality_widgets).pack(side="left", padx=(20, 0))

        # CRF slider
        self.crf_frame = ttk.Frame(quality_frame)
        self.crf_frame.grid(row=1, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="ew", pady=(10, 0))
        ttk.Label(self.crf_frame, text="Quality:").pack(side="left")
        self.crf_var = tk.IntVar(value=23)
        self.crf_scale = ttk.Scale(self.crf_frame, from_=18, to=35, variable=self.crf_var, orient="horizontal", command=self._update_crf_label)
        self.crf_scale.pack(side="left", fill="x", expand=True, padx=(10, 10))
        self.crf_label = ttk.Label(self.crf_frame, text="23 (Balanced)", width=20)
        self.crf_label.pack(side="left")

        # Bitrate input
        self.bitrate_frame = ttk.Frame(quality_frame)
        self.bitrate_frame.grid(row=2, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="ew", pady=(10, 0))
        ttk.Label(self.bitrate_frame, text="Target Bitrate:").pack(side="left")
        self.bitrate_var = tk.StringVar(value="5000")
        ttk.Entry(self.bitrate_frame, textvariable=self.bitrate_var, width=10).pack(side="left", padx=(10, 0))
        ttk.Label(self.bitrate_frame, text="kbps").pack(side="left", padx=(5, 0))
        self.bitrate_frame.grid_remove()

        ttk.Label(quality_frame, text="Preset:").grid(row=3, column=0, sticky="w", pady=(10, 0))
        self.preset_var = tk.StringVar()
        self.preset_combo = ttk.Combobox(quality_frame, textvariable=self.preset_var, state="readonly", width=15)
        self.preset_combo.grid(row=3, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(10, 0), pady=(10, 0))
        ttk.Label(quality_frame, text="(Slower = smaller file)", foreground="gray").grid(row=3, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(170, 0), pady=(10, 0))

        # === Resolution Section ===
        res_frame = ttk.LabelFrame(main_frame, text="Resolution", padding="10")
        res_frame.grid(row=row, column=0, sticky="ew", pady=(0, 10))
        res_frame.columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
        row += 1

        ttk.Label(res_frame, text="Resolution:").grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="w")
        self.resolution_var = tk.StringVar(value="Keep Original")
        self.resolution_combo = ttk.Combobox(res_frame, textvariable=self.resolution_var, values=list(self.RESOLUTIONS.keys()), state="readonly", width=15)
        self.resolution_combo.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(10, 0))
        self.resolution_combo.bind("<<ComboboxSelected>>", self._on_resolution_changed)

        self.custom_res_frame = ttk.Frame(res_frame)
        self.custom_res_frame.grid(row=1, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(10, 0), pady=(10, 0))
        self.custom_width_var = tk.StringVar(value="1920")
        self.custom_height_var = tk.StringVar(value="1080")
        ttk.Entry(self.custom_res_frame, textvariable=self.custom_width_var, width=6).pack(side="left")
        ttk.Label(self.custom_res_frame, text=" x ").pack(side="left")
        ttk.Entry(self.custom_res_frame, textvariable=self.custom_height_var, width=6).pack(side="left")
        self.custom_res_frame.grid_remove()

        # === Frame Rate Section ===
        ttk.Label(res_frame, text="Frame Rate:").grid(row=2, column=0, sticky="w", pady=(10, 0))
        self.fps_var = tk.StringVar(value="Keep Original")
        ttk.Combobox(res_frame, textvariable=self.fps_var, values=self.FRAME_RATES, state="readonly", width=15).grid(row=2, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(10, 0), pady=(10, 0))

        # === Audio Section ===
        audio_frame = ttk.LabelFrame(main_frame, text="Audio", padding="10")
        audio_frame.grid(row=row, column=0, sticky="ew", pady=(0, 10))
        audio_frame.columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
        row += 1

        ttk.Label(audio_frame, text="Audio:").grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="w")
        self.audio_mode_var = tk.StringVar(value="reencode")
        audio_mode_frame = ttk.Frame(audio_frame)
        audio_mode_frame.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(10, 0))
        ttk.Radiobutton(audio_mode_frame, text="Re-encode AAC", variable=self.audio_mode_var, value="reencode", command=self._update_audio_widgets).pack(side="left")
        ttk.Radiobutton(audio_mode_frame, text="Copy Original", variable=self.audio_mode_var, value="copy", command=self._update_audio_widgets).pack(side="left", padx=(20, 0))
        ttk.Radiobutton(audio_mode_frame, text="Remove", variable=self.audio_mode_var, value="remove", command=self._update_audio_widgets).pack(side="left", padx=(20, 0))

        self.audio_bitrate_frame = ttk.Frame(audio_frame)
        self.audio_bitrate_frame.grid(row=1, column=1, sticky="w", padx=(10, 0), pady=(10, 0))
        ttk.Label(self.audio_bitrate_frame, text="Bitrate:").pack(side="left")
        self.audio_bitrate_var = tk.StringVar(value="128k")
        ttk.Combobox(self.audio_bitrate_frame, textvariable=self.audio_bitrate_var, values=self.AUDIO_BITRATES, state="readonly", width=8).pack(side="left", padx=(10, 0))

        # === Progress Section ===
        progress_frame = ttk.LabelFrame(main_frame, text="Progress", padding="10")
        progress_frame.grid(row=row, column=0, sticky="ew", pady=(0, 10))
        progress_frame.columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
        row += 1

        self.progress_var = tk.DoubleVar(value=0)
        self.progress_bar = ttk.Progressbar(progress_frame, variable=self.progress_var, maximum=100)
        self.progress_bar.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="ew")

        self.status_var = tk.StringVar(value="Ready")
        self.status_label = ttk.Label(progress_frame, textvariable=self.status_var, foreground="gray")
        self.status_label.grid(row=1, column=0, sticky="w", pady=(5, 0))

        self.result_text = tk.Text(progress_frame, height=4, state="disabled", wrap="word")
        self.result_text.grid(row=2, column=0, sticky="ew", pady=(10, 0))

        # === Buttons ===
        button_frame = ttk.Frame(main_frame)
        button_frame.grid(row=row, column=0, sticky="ew", pady=(10, 0))
        row += 1

        self.compress_btn = ttk.Button(button_frame, text="Compress", command=self._start_compression)
        self.compress_btn.pack(side="left")

        self.cancel_btn = ttk.Button(button_frame, text="Cancel", command=self._cancel_compression, state="disabled")
        self.cancel_btn.pack(side="left", padx=(10, 0))

    def _setup_drag_and_drop(self):
        """Configure drag-and-drop if available."""
        if not HAS_DND:
            self.drop_label.config(text="Drop video files here\n(install tkinterdnd2 for drag-drop)\nor click Browse")
            return

        # Register drop target on the drop frame and label
        self.drop_frame.drop_target_register(DND_FILES)
        self.drop_frame.dnd_bind("<<Drop>>", self._on_drop)
        self.drop_frame.dnd_bind("<<DragEnter>>", self._on_drag_enter)
        self.drop_frame.dnd_bind("<<DragLeave>>", self._on_drag_leave)

        self.drop_label.drop_target_register(DND_FILES)
        self.drop_label.dnd_bind("<<Drop>>", self._on_drop)
        self.drop_label.dnd_bind("<<DragEnter>>", self._on_drag_enter)
        self.drop_label.dnd_bind("<<DragLeave>>", self._on_drag_leave)

    def _on_drop(self, event):
        """Handle files dropped onto the drop zone."""
        # Parse the dropped file paths
        data = event.data
        files = self._parse_drop_data(data)

        # Filter for video files
        video_extensions = {".mp4", ".mkv", ".avi", ".mov", ".webm", ".flv", ".wmv", ".m4v"}
        video_files = [f for f in files if Path(f).suffix.lower() in video_extensions]

        if video_files:
            self.input_files = [Path(f) for f in video_files]
            if len(self.input_files) == 1:
                self.input_label.config(text=self.input_files[0].name, foreground="black")
                self.drop_label.config(text=f"Selected: {self.input_files[0].name}")
            else:
                self.input_label.config(text=f"{len(self.input_files)} files selected", foreground="black")
                self.drop_label.config(text=f"Selected: {len(self.input_files)} video files")
        else:
            messagebox.showwarning("Invalid Files", "No valid video files found in drop.")

        # Reset drop zone appearance
        self._on_drag_leave(None)

    def _parse_drop_data(self, data: str) -> list[str]:
        """Parse dropped file data which may contain multiple files."""
        files = []
        # Handle different formats: space-separated, with {} for paths with spaces
        if "{" in data:
            # Format: {/path/with spaces/file.mp4} {/another/file.mp4}
            import re
            files = re.findall(r"\{([^}]+)\}", data)
            # Also get non-bracketed items
            remaining = re.sub(r"\{[^}]+\}", "", data).strip()
            if remaining:
                files.extend(remaining.split())
        else:
            files = data.split()

        return [f for f in files if f]

    def _on_drag_enter(self, event):
        """Highlight drop zone when dragging over."""
        self.drop_frame.config(bg="#d0e8ff", highlightbackground="#0078d4")
        self.drop_label.config(bg="#d0e8ff", fg="#0078d4", text="Drop to add files")

    def _on_drag_leave(self, event):
        """Reset drop zone appearance."""
        self.drop_frame.config(bg="#e8e8e8", highlightbackground="#aaaaaa")
        if self.input_files:
            if len(self.input_files) == 1:
                text = f"Selected: {self.input_files[0].name}"
            else:
                text = f"Selected: {len(self.input_files)} video files"
        else:
            text = "Drop video files here\nor click Browse"
        self.drop_label.config(bg="#e8e8e8", fg="#666666", text=text)

    def _update_encoder_options(self, event=None):
        """Update encoder dropdown based on selected codec."""
        codec = self.codec_var.get()
        matching = [(name, info) for name, info in self.available_encoders.items() if info.codec == codec]

        # Sort: hardware encoders first
        matching.sort(key=lambda x: (not x[1].is_hardware, x[0]))

        encoder_names = [info.display_name for _, info in matching]
        self.encoder_combo["values"] = encoder_names

        if encoder_names:
            self.encoder_combo.current(0)
            self._on_encoder_changed()

    def _on_encoder_changed(self, event=None):
        """Update presets when encoder changes."""
        display_name = self.encoder_var.get()
        for name, info in self.available_encoders.items():
            if info.display_name == display_name:
                self.preset_combo["values"] = info.presets
                mid_idx = len(info.presets) // 2
                self.preset_combo.current(mid_idx)
                break

    def _update_quality_widgets(self):
        """Show/hide quality widgets based on mode."""
        if self.quality_mode_var.get() == "crf":
            self.crf_frame.grid()
            self.bitrate_frame.grid_remove()
        else:
            self.crf_frame.grid_remove()
            self.bitrate_frame.grid()

    def _update_crf_label(self, value=None):
        """Update CRF label with quality description."""
        crf = int(float(self.crf_var.get()))
        if crf <= 18:
            desc = "High Quality"
        elif crf <= 23:
            desc = "Balanced"
        elif crf <= 28:
            desc = "Smaller File"
        else:
            desc = "Low Quality"
        self.crf_label.config(text=f"{crf} ({desc})")

    def _update_audio_widgets(self):
        """Show/hide audio bitrate based on mode."""
        if self.audio_mode_var.get() == "reencode":
            self.audio_bitrate_frame.grid()
        else:
            self.audio_bitrate_frame.grid_remove()

    def _on_resolution_changed(self, event=None):
        """Show/hide custom resolution inputs."""
        if self.resolution_var.get() == "Custom":
            self.custom_res_frame.grid()
        else:
            self.custom_res_frame.grid_remove()

    def _browse_input(self):
        """Open file browser for input files."""
        filetypes = [
            ("Video files", "*.mp4 *.mkv *.avi *.mov *.webm *.flv *.wmv *.m4v"),
            ("All files", "*.*"),
        ]
        files = filedialog.askopenfilenames(title="Select Video Files", filetypes=filetypes)
        if files:
            self.input_files = [Path(f) for f in files]
            if len(self.input_files) == 1:
                self.input_label.config(text=self.input_files[0].name, foreground="black")
            else:
                self.input_label.config(text=f"{len(self.input_files)} files selected", foreground="black")

    def _clear_input(self):
        """Clear selected input files."""
        self.input_files = []
        self.input_label.config(text="No files selected", foreground="gray")
        self.drop_label.config(text="Drop video files here\nor click Browse")

    def _browse_output(self):
        """Open folder browser for output."""
        folder = filedialog.askdirectory(title="Select Output Folder")
        if folder:
            self.output_var.set(folder)

    def _get_encoder_info(self) -> EncoderInfo | None:
        """Get the currently selected encoder info."""
        display_name = self.encoder_var.get()
        for name, info in self.available_encoders.items():
            if info.display_name == display_name:
                return info
        return None

    def _get_encoder_name(self) -> str | None:
        """Get the FFmpeg encoder name for the selected encoder."""
        display_name = self.encoder_var.get()
        for name, info in self.available_encoders.items():
            if info.display_name == display_name:
                return name
        return None

    def _build_ffmpeg_command(self, input_path: Path, output_path: Path) -> list[str]:
        """Build the FFmpeg command with all options."""
        encoder_name = self._get_encoder_name()
        encoder_info = self._get_encoder_info()

        cmd = ["ffmpeg", "-y", "-i", str(input_path)]

        # Video encoder
        cmd.extend(["-c:v", encoder_name])

        # Quality settings
        if self.quality_mode_var.get() == "crf":
            quality_val = int(self.crf_var.get())
            if encoder_info.quality_param == "cq":
                cmd.extend(["-rc", "constqp", "-cq", str(quality_val)])
            elif encoder_info.quality_param == "global_quality":
                cmd.extend(["-global_quality", str(quality_val)])
            elif encoder_info.quality_param == "qp_i":
                cmd.extend(["-rc", "cqp", "-qp_i", str(quality_val), "-qp_p", str(quality_val), "-qp_b", str(quality_val)])
            else:
                cmd.extend(["-crf", str(quality_val)])
        else:
            bitrate = self.bitrate_var.get()
            cmd.extend(["-b:v", f"{bitrate}k"])

        # Preset
        preset = self.preset_var.get()
        if encoder_name in ("h264_nvenc", "hevc_nvenc"):
            cmd.extend(["-preset", preset])
        elif encoder_name in ("h264_amf", "hevc_amf"):
            cmd.extend(["-quality", preset])
        else:
            cmd.extend(["-preset", preset])

        # Resolution
        resolution = self.resolution_var.get()
        scale_filter = None
        if resolution == "Custom":
            w = self.custom_width_var.get()
            h = self.custom_height_var.get()
            scale_filter = f"scale={w}:{h}"
        elif resolution != "Keep Original":
            res_value = self.RESOLUTIONS[resolution]
            if res_value:
                w, h = res_value.split("x")
                scale_filter = f"scale={w}:{h}:force_original_aspect_ratio=decrease"

        # Frame rate
        fps = self.fps_var.get()
        fps_filter = None
        if fps != "Keep Original":
            fps_filter = f"fps={fps}"

        # Combine video filters
        vf_parts = [f for f in [scale_filter, fps_filter] if f]
        if vf_parts:
            cmd.extend(["-vf", ",".join(vf_parts)])

        # Audio settings
        audio_mode = self.audio_mode_var.get()
        if audio_mode == "reencode":
            cmd.extend(["-c:a", "aac", "-b:a", self.audio_bitrate_var.get()])
        elif audio_mode == "copy":
            cmd.extend(["-c:a", "copy"])
        else:
            cmd.append("-an")

        cmd.append(str(output_path))
        return cmd

    def _get_video_duration(self, path: Path) -> float | None:
        """Get video duration in seconds using ffprobe."""
        try:
            result = subprocess.run(
                [
                    "ffprobe", "-v", "quiet", "-print_format", "json",
                    "-show_format", str(path)
                ],
                capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=30
            )
            data = json.loads(result.stdout)
            return float(data["format"]["duration"])
        except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, json.JSONDecodeError, KeyError, FileNotFoundError):
            return None

    def _parse_progress(self, line: str, duration: float | None) -> float | None:
        """Parse FFmpeg output to get progress percentage."""
        if duration is None:
            return None
        time_match = re.search(r"time=(\d+):(\d+):(\d+\.?\d*)", line)
        if time_match:
            h, m, s = time_match.groups()
            current = int(h) * 3600 + int(m) * 60 + float(s)
            return min(100, (current / duration) * 100)
        return None

    def _update_status(self, message: str, color: str = "gray"):
        """Update status label (thread-safe)."""
        self.root.after(0, lambda: self.status_var.set(message))
        self.root.after(0, lambda: self.status_label.config(foreground=color))

    def _update_progress(self, value: float):
        """Update progress bar (thread-safe)."""
        self.root.after(0, lambda: self.progress_var.set(value))

    def _append_result(self, text: str):
        """Append text to result area (thread-safe)."""
        def _append():
            self.result_text.config(state="normal")
            self.result_text.insert("end", text + "\n")
            self.result_text.see("end")
            self.result_text.config(state="disabled")
        self.root.after(0, _append)

    def _clear_result(self):
        """Clear result area."""
        self.result_text.config(state="normal")
        self.result_text.delete("1.0", "end")
        self.result_text.config(state="disabled")

    def _compression_finished(self, success: bool):
        """Called when compression completes (thread-safe)."""
        def _finish():
            self.is_compressing = False
            self.compress_btn.config(state="normal")
            self.cancel_btn.config(state="disabled")
            if success:
                self._update_status("Completed!", "green")
            elif self.cancel_requested:
                self._update_status("Cancelled", "orange")
            else:
                self._update_status("Failed", "red")
        self.root.after(0, _finish)

    def _start_compression(self):
        """Start the compression process."""
        if not self.input_files:
            messagebox.showwarning("No Input", "Please select input video files.")
            return

        self.is_compressing = True
        self.cancel_requested = False
        self.compress_btn.config(state="disabled")
        self.cancel_btn.config(state="normal")
        self._clear_result()
        self._update_progress(0)

        thread = threading.Thread(target=self._compress_files, daemon=True)
        thread.start()

    def _cancel_compression(self):
        """Cancel the current compression."""
        self.cancel_requested = True
        if self.current_process:
            self.current_process.terminate()

    def _compress_files(self):
        """Compress all input files (runs in background thread)."""
        total_files = len(self.input_files)
        total_input_size = 0
        total_output_size = 0

        for i, input_path in enumerate(self.input_files):
            if self.cancel_requested:
                break

            self._update_status(f"Processing {i+1}/{total_files}: {input_path.name}")

            # Determine output path
            output_dir = self.output_var.get()
            if output_dir == "Same as input":
                output_dir = input_path.parent
            else:
                output_dir = Path(output_dir)

            suffix = self.suffix_var.get()
            container = self.container_var.get()
            output_path = output_dir / f"{input_path.stem}{suffix}{container}"

            # Get duration for progress
            duration = self._get_video_duration(input_path)

            # Build and run command
            cmd = self._build_ffmpeg_command(input_path, output_path)

            try:
                self.current_process = subprocess.Popen(
                    cmd, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
                    text=True, bufsize=1
                )

                for line in self.current_process.stderr:
                    if self.cancel_requested:
                        break
                    progress = self._parse_progress(line, duration)
                    if progress is not None:
                        # Adjust for multiple files
                        overall = (i * 100 + progress) / total_files
                        self._update_progress(overall)

                self.current_process.wait()

                if self.current_process.returncode == 0 and output_path.exists():
                    input_size = input_path.stat().st_size / (1024 * 1024)
                    output_size = output_path.stat().st_size / (1024 * 1024)
                    reduction = (1 - output_size / input_size) * 100

                    total_input_size += input_size
                    total_output_size += output_size

                    self._append_result(
                        f"{input_path.name}: {input_size:.1f}MB  {output_size:.1f}MB ({reduction:.1f}% smaller)"
                    )
                elif not self.cancel_requested:
                    self._append_result(f"{input_path.name}: FAILED")

            except Exception as e:
                self._append_result(f"{input_path.name}: Error - {str(e)}")

        # Summary
        if total_files > 1 and total_input_size > 0:
            total_reduction = (1 - total_output_size / total_input_size) * 100
            self._append_result(f"\nTotal: {total_input_size:.1f}MB  {total_output_size:.1f}MB ({total_reduction:.1f}% smaller)")

        self._update_progress(100 if not self.cancel_requested else 0)
        self._compression_finished(not self.cancel_requested)


def main():
    if HAS_DND:
        root = TkinterDnD.Tk()
    else:
        root = tk.Tk()
    app = VideoCompressorGUI(root)
    root.mainloop()


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

input.old_string:
#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""Video Compressor GUI with hardware acceleration support."""

import json
import os
import re
import subprocess
import threading
import tkinter as tk

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""Video Compressor GUI with hardware acceleration support."""

import json
import logging
import os
import re
import subprocess
import sys
import threading
import tkinter as tk
import traceback
from tkinter import ttk, filedialog, messagebox
from pathlib import Path
from dataclasses import dataclass
from datetime import datetime
from typing import Callable

# Setup logging to file
LOG_FILE = Path("/app/video_compressor.log") if Path("/app").exists() else Path("video_compressor.log")
logging.basicConfig(
    level=logging.DEBUG,
    format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',
    handlers=[
        logging.FileHandler(LOG_FILE, mode='w'),
        logging.StreamHandler(sys.stdout)
    ]
)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

    from tkinterdnd2 import DND_FILES, TkinterDnD
    HAS_DND = True
    logger.info("tkinterdnd2 loaded successfully")
except ImportError as e:
    HAS_DND = False
    logger.warning(f"tkinterdnd2 not available: {e}")
